description: From gall +â€Ž -ing. The adjective follows from the verb.

adjectives.description: galling (comparative more galling, superlative most galling)

entries.meaning: Vexing, humiliating; eliciting indignation or bitterness.
examples: Uruguay were quick to the ball, strong in the tackle and seemed intent on showing they were a better team than had been apparent in their defeat to Costa Rica. Yet the most galling part for England is that they helped them on their way.

entries.meaning: Material transfer caused by adhesion between sliding surfaces, potentially resulting in wear or binding.
